subject: Data
title: Thinking in Probabilities, Not Certainties
description: A fast breakdown of Thinking in Probabilities, Not Certainties for builders.

hook.text: The weather forecast says 30% chance of rain. You get rained on. Was the forecast wrong?

buildup.text: No â€” a 30% chance means it rains 3 out of 10 times. You just experienced one of those 3.

discovery.text: Probabilistic thinking means accepting uncertainty instead of demanding yes-or-no answers from data.

twist.text: Humans crave certainty. We misread '90% likely' as 'guaranteed' and '10% likely' as 'impossible.'

climax.text: The data-literate mind thinks in ranges and likelihoods, not in black-and-white predictions.

quiz.question: If a forecast says 30% chance of rain and it rains, was the forecast wrong?
options: Yes, anything below 50% means no rain
